revised_title: Growth and Behavior of Isolated Plant Cells in Vitro
tldr: The author investigates the growth and behavior of isolated plant cells in vitro. They observe that plant cells can grow in size but do not divide. The cells show active protoplasmic streaming and cyclosis, and their behavior is studied using phase-contrast microscopy. The author concludes that isolated plant cells are not capable of cell division under the described conditions and a different procedure must be used to achieve cell multiplication.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
